question: When $FeCl_3$ is added to excess of hot water gives a sol 'X'. When $FeCl_3$ is added to $NaOH_{(aq)}$ solution, gives sol 'Y'. X and Y formed in the above processes respectively are:
explanation: X: Hydrolysis of $FeCl_3$ in hot water creates Positively charged sol due to adsorption of common ion $Fe^{3+}$ ($Fe_2O_3.xH_2O/Fe^{3+}$).
Y: Reaction with NaOH creates Negatively charged sol due to adsorption of $OH^-$ ($Fe_2O_3.xH_2O/OH^-$).
